comment: very amazing teacher cared about your future,just a rough grader which make sense sadly she is retiring and hoping the best for her.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Caring--Respected

comment: She's a very nice professor. Very attendance heavy. Attend every single lecture and submit your work on time. I really like her but she talks alot sometimes but other than that shes a good prof
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took Schofer for 1102 and she is honestly a good professor she doesn't want anyone to fail.  She requires a textbook for the class and is super strict on attendance, but if you're taking an in-person class, show up. But overall Professor Schofer is a really nice lady and I would take her class again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Attendance is super important, if you skip class she gets mad and gets other students to try and contact you to find out where you are. The class overall is super straightforward, two papers with a partner project and some smaller assignments. Overall I would recommend her for an easy class, but not the nicest professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Get the textbook and turn in assignments, as long as you turn homework assignments you should get a good grade
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Hilarious

comment: I took her for ENG 1101 and it consisted of 3 essays, some quizzes, and homework. The quizzes for the most part were open notes. The homework is usually a completion grade to make sure you've read what she wants to discuss in class. She is very sweet and nice. The papers are easy to get at least an 85 on. Would recommend it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Respected

comment: She is a sweet lady, but doesnt quite pass for a great professor. She talks through out class the whole time, even while everyone is doing their own work. Attendance was very important to her. She is very picky when it comes to grading papers. I would get extra help with my papers and still barely get an A on them. Overall wouldnt take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: As far as college professors go this is about as good as it gets. That being said objectively speaking she was very uptight and just flat out annoying. While she is very organized prepare yourself, because she talks the entirety of the hour and fifteen minutes I was in there. However, the good over shadows the bad, she is very good at teaching.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: I've taken both 1101 and 1102 with this sweetheart of a teacher. She really wants to help her students and is a funny lady. I will say she does have favorites, and shows it but she just likes to see her students put in the same effort she does. The papers can be a little tough, but ask for help and participate and you're golden!

The class has three essays (one being your final) and a few homework grades/ participation grades. However, she makes the participation aspect easy. On the essays she provides great feedback. You do the work, you get a good grade. She is AMAZING at reminding you of upcoming due dates as well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: The sweetest lady ever. Class isnt too hard, a few papers and easy assignments. The essays are more difficult but shes very helpful. She loves her jobs and has made this class super great during a pandemic.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: I had her for 1101 and 1102. I tried on every single one of my papers and got high B's or low A's. The homework is not difficult. The reading is a little annoying. Great teacher overall.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Schofer was great! She took attendance every class and after your 2nd absence, it starts to affect your grade. There was not much work for the class, just 4 papers (one counts as your final) and online assignments every Friday that were really easy. Each paper is worth 20% of your grade, but were impossible to get A's on.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Nice professor, but can be a tough class. She gives a lot of homework during the week, so you have to keep track of it. While she is a tough grader, she is not super unreasonable. Just make sure you put in some effort and she'll be lenient.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She lets you know what she wants, and as long as you do it, shell love you. She designed the class so that even if you arent a good writer you can get an A as long as you do your homework (which usually takes 10 minutes). The only people who struggled in my class were the people that didnt come or have their textbook. Youre lucky to have her!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She was an absolute blast to be taught by. I struggle slightly with writing but her feedback always helped me to improve my writing. You are required to bring a textbook to class often so be aware of that! The homework was always easy and overall this class was a breeze. Definitely the teacher you wanna take for your English courses!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Class is mandatory but you are allowed to miss one or two days depending on the course. She is somewhat of a tough grader for her papers, but only because she gives you all the tools to make a B or above. People that give her poor ratings don't want to put in effort. The online homework is easy as long as you keep up with it. I highly recommend!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Schofer makes her expectations of the class clear from the beginning. Papers are graded quickly so you always know where your grade stands. If you pay attention in class and complete the (easy) weekly homework, you should be fine. Overall, a great Intro to Comp experience.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: She was sweet and her work wasn't too hard. It was very straightforward and simple.
Great Teacher! Super nice and caring. If you do all the HW and stay on top you will succeed but if you don't you won't. I'd defiantly take her again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of my favorite professors here at KSU. She wants her students to do well and offers extra credit. She is clear & thorough on how papers should be written. I got a B on my 1st paper and an A on the 2nd. I took the hybrid class and her online assignments are easy and under 20 mins. Sometimes she cancels the online portion. Love her. Recommended!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Mrs. Schofer's class was very interactive. She clearly cares and wants people to think and learn. Show up, do your homework, do well on your essays, and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: She will roast you all the time in front of the class but she genuinely wants you to do well and if you show up and try you will do well. She grades hard on papers, if you try hard youll do fine. She knows what shes talking about.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Schofer is underrated. she may sound condescending but she is actually very sweet and enthusiastic. her class is very straightforward and not assignment or lecture heavy at all. just four essays & online homework, no final. cons are dont skip and dont go on your phone or youll get called out. easy A nonetheless.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's a great teacher who makes sure everyone is in touch with the material we're reading. Get on her good side it will pay off!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Schofer is an absolute sweetheart. If you are struggling with writing essays, this is the professor to take. She grades tough because of the Department guidelines. That being said, she gives great feedback on your essays. Attendance is required. She tends to repeat too much and can also call students out loudly., but take her if you can.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Participation matters

comment: Professor Schofer is a sweet lady who gives freshman multiple chances to receive an A. She doesnt just hand out As, but if you enjoy writing and put forth effort, you will be fine. If you make high Bs on all four papers (and one project) and do your HW, youll get an A. She also offers extra credit for HW if you go to a wc workshop.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: 4 papers total, all on very interesting topics! You even get to write a movie review. She is a very tough grader, especially on the first paper so work really hard on the first one. GO TO CLASS attendance matters a lot to her. Very funny lady and she will help you improve your writing. You need a book. Do all the homework. No final or tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I do not recommend this class. Personally, I did not enjoy it at all. There is a lot of homework and in class work. She also takes role everyday, and you don't get that many absences. I would choose a different professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Schofer is nice as long as you don't mess up. She will call you out in front of everyone if you do something she doesn't understand on a paper or in discussion. There are four papers with one project, lots of reading and analysis, but no final. Just buy the textbook and show up to class and you should be fine. She offers some extra credit
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I don't recommend her unconditionally; if you mess up, she'll call you out unmercifully. That said, she is a fine instructor who cares about her students and fosters lots of classroom discussion. If you do all the homework, you can get Bs on most of the papers and still get an A. Cite everything (including the Powerpoint) and buy the textbook.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Mrs. Schofer is a professional, hardworking, and energetic teacher. If you want a class you can disappear into, don't take her! If you want a teacher who'll take the time to provide feedback and help you learn, she's the the one for you. Do your work, turn things in on time, and you'll do very well. She'll help you pass, if you hold up your end.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: I took her for 1101 and 1102. I wasn't a strong writer but she is very helpful. Rough draft workshops are super helpful. She learns everyone's name. Do the homework (which is easy 100%) and get B's on her 4 papers and you'll get a A. No tests or final. 4 papers all semester.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: A bit difficult, Worked hard but got about 10 points less than expected most of the time. Often will help, but will sometimes rush students. Usually a nice teacher, though, and amazing lectures. Work extensively on all essays, don't slack on the first few (grading gets progressively harder). Always turn rough draft in, It helps final draft grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I took her for a learning community and she is super nice. Loves to take one kid and pick on them if they'll take it. if she likes you you'll pretty much get a good grade in the class. 4 essays and a project plus homework but even if you get a B on all the essays you can still have an A. takes attendance religiously. Favorite freshman professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: She gets annoying but is really helpful if you ask her the right questions. She will call you out on some stuff but just don't take it personal. The class is super easy. You can have 8 absences. She sort of a tough grader.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters

comment: Professor calls you out 24/7, talks down to you, grades papers so hard. Would never take again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: All the ratings I have seen say she is a tough grader, but you really just have to do above the bare minimum for the essays and have correct grammar, and you will do fine. Lots of homework at beginning of the semester, but the assignments are usually interesting topics. She seems to really care about her students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I know many people did not like her, but I thought she was a good teacher overall. She loves what she does, and she makes sure to learn everyone's name and connects with them. She is very easy to talk to. Tough grader, but very helpful.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Schofer is a good professor to take for Enlish 1101, but it isn't all the way easy. You do have homework assignments that she takes for a grade. She takes attendance serious, and she grades her papers HARD. Also, her voice can be annoying sometimes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She was very sweet, but she could easily go on and on about things that were self explanatory. This class isn't hard if you put in the effort that a college course requires. Good luck!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Participation matters

comment: Only write 4 papers, fairly easy to get a B in the class. Grades very strictly and does not just hand out A's on the papers. She is also very strict on attendance and will kick you out of class if you've missed too many days without notice.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: She is a GREAT prof. She is perfect to have for your first english class. She is so sweet and she really cares about everyone in the class. When you speak your opinion in class in a project or discussion she really listens. I really tried getting her for 1102, but her class filled up too fast. If you try you should get a good grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: The class is easy as long as you write your essays. Her on the other hand, annoying. Once you get past her personality the class flies by.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Schofer was a great professor to have for my first college english class. She was very helpful and never too harsh in grading. She also gets papers graded and returned EXTREMELY quick which is great. Tried taking her for 1102 but her class filled up way too fast :/
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very tough grader with essays, but she helps in any way she can and its a fairly easy class to get a B in and if you follow her instructions an A shouldn't be out of the question.

Expect discussions of the assigned reading homework. She doesn't really give you feedback on your rough drafts of papers. Sometimes she does not even teach and gives you the day to work on assignments for her class. No cell phone policy. Her voice can get a little bit annoying.
You need to go to class

A great teacher. Always shows up eager and ready to converse. Must participate in lectures and discussions. Need the text book for homework. Easy class except 4 essays that you will never get an A on because it is the School Policy on grading. Essay 4 is averaged with a final presentation with a partner. Would take again.
She is a very tough grader when it comes to papers. She can be a bit condescending as well.

Class discussions where very controversial and if you had different opions with her she would tell you that you where wrong and talk down to you. She really does not grade papers. If she likes you you start of making B's and move up to A's. If she does not like you, you start at C's or D's and move to B's or C's. Will never take again.

This professor shows up to class everyday enthusiastic and sharp. She will challenge you to do your best and makes you think throughout classes; they can be fun and hilarious during discussion. This class may not be for laid back students but if you are a hard worker and want to succeed, I recommend this professor to you.
Textbooks are REQUIRED! She is a great teacher but a  really tough grader. I wasn't a fan of the round table discussions or group projects. It's not an easy A class. Good luck if you pick her.

Professor Schofer is a nice and helpful teacher. She tries to engage everyone in group discussions and wants to hear feed back from everyone. She assigns homework and checks it for participation . She will make sure you understand the writing assignments and will give extra help. She will let you replace lowest grade in class.

4 papers won't get an A unless you "work for it" but if you try you will most likely get a B on the papers, easy homework and rountable disscussions that'll help your grade. There is an easy group project too.

I just finished this class as part of the Dual Enrollment Honors Program at KSU (I'm a high school senior) and Ms. Schofer is a good first prof. to have. You won't get an A on a paper, but the class is fairly laid back. We had no final, had 4 papers, and a group project. She updates her blog regularly.

You will NOT get an A on a paper!! I spent countless hours on my papers and never got more than a B, she will not give out As on papers because she thinks no one can write to her standards, she does give easy homework assignments and group project that help your grade

This was kinda a boring class but not too difficult. 4 papers, 1 group project, and small homework assignments. She's a tough grader and doesn't give out As on papers easily. Roundtable discussions were super annoying too but overall not a bad professor.

She's very passionate and committed to her students. Butt one of the toughest grader on papers. 4 papers and a group project. "Round table" discussions were okay because all we had to do was say our opinion. Hard to get an A on a paper. Good teacher overall

You will get an a or b! Do small easy assignments. You can get c's on all essays and get a B. Show her you care. Ask her what you need to improve on and your essays will get better. If you participate in class she will love you. She is cool so take her but understand you must ask her to tell you your writing weaknesses..... SON
I never enjoyed the "roundtable discussions" or just the class in general.

Absolutely the best professor I have ever had, as long as you write your papers,turn them in on time,and express a strong opinion in them she will give you a good grade, as long as you are clear and your grammar is correct, got an A in her class, amazing teacher

Professor Schofer was the best English teacher I've ever had. Kept class simple and clear and assigned 4 easy papers that she allowed us to peer review. She knows everyone's names and if you speak up in class and stay involved she will help you get the grade you need. Fair grader and very understanding.

Professor Schofer was the best English teacher I've ever had. Kept class simple and clear and assigned 4 easy papers that she allowed us to peer review. She knows everyone's names and if you speak up in class and stay involved she will help you get the grade you need. Fair grader and very understanding.

Loved her! Her passion for writing is contagious, but if you won't work for your grade to improve your writing, this is the wrong class for you. She is very approachable and crystal clear with her suggestions of what can help your writing. She uses drafting days so you can complete most of your work in class! Extra credit for 100% attendance.

Professor Schofer is a very fair teacher who strives to have her students do well. She is always pushing you to become a better writer, but more than willing to take the time to explain things and get you to that next level of writing. This class is not the most difficult but you need to stay on top of assignments. She even allows some extra credit

There are no tests in this class, and your papers are a strong percent. Even if English isn't your strong point, you still have a good chance to do well. She's always more happy to review your work with you. If you do the couple of homework assignments and come to class she will work with you to help you succeed. Textbooks are definitely required.

She is a very passionate teacher. That's number one. If you want to actually learn something and become prepared for writing in college CORRECTLY, then you're taking the right class with her. If you are still in a high school mindset and prefer a teacher who will slide you along without actually getting an education, then you're taking the wrong teacher and should probably not be in college. Go work at mcDonalds and leave the degrees to the people who take it seriously. Great teacher! Loved her!

Great teacher!Do your work and you will make the grade!Be lazy then you will complain about her.She is so nice and gives us all the support and opportunity to learn and make good grades.10 OUT OF 10.....

Great teacher!she does an awesome job at making sure we all understood what she was teaching.Prof. Schofer falls nothing shot of the best English teachers i have ever had.I wish i could have her again for my eng.1102.I would definitely recommend her to anyone looking to take eng.1101. Fastest grader on campus too.Thanks Prof Schofer!!

Well I took her my freshman year, I am a Junior now. She is very rude and unclear about assignments. Every essay I wrote was never good enough. I just did not like her at all. That aside, she wasnt even a good teacher.

She is a good professor. The class is not easy, but because of that I have become a way better writer. She gives interesting topics to write about. She wants you to succeed and is VERY passionate about writing. I recommend her.

Prof. Schofer was a nice lady but definitely a hard grader. It seemed like nothing could please her. I never made above a C on any of the essay assignments and I opted out of 1101 with an AP test score. So I knew I wasn't just a terrible writer. She doesn't give many assignments but when she does she does not clearly explain what she wants.
Mrs. Schofer was nice enough, but came off as condescending sometimes. Easy enough class, most people should make A's and B's. Rounds your final average up a point (89 up to 90, etc.)

Easy B!! Just come to class and turn in stuff on time. She lets you re-do one of the essays. I was really having trouble & asked if I could re-do another essay I got a C- and she let me! Tough grader but she works to help you both in class and outside of class thru emails. She seems to care about the class.

Comes off as rude and condescending, but in reality is much nicer than she acts. You just have to show her than you are willing to work for a good grade. If you do, she will be more than willing to help you. I think she probably bumped some of my grades up just because I showed that I was putting forth some effort. Just show her that youre trying.

I love,love Prof.Schofer.She is CRYSTAL clear on assignments.I made an "A" in the class with something called effort.This is college people and you should choose essay topics that haven't been beaten to death. BE CREATIVE!she truly cares about her students.her grading system is more than fair.You get the grade you earn, its college!

I love, love, love Prof. Schofer! she is crystal clear about assignments. Do not pick a topic that has been beaten to death. Its college people, think a little outside of the box! I received an "A" in the class by putting forth some effort and creativity. She truly cares about her students! I highly recommend her! remember you EARN your grades!
unable to articulate what she wants. does not tech you anything and talks to you as if you were 8 years old

Not helpful.  Knows what she wants from your papers but doesn't clearly tell you.  If you pick a topic she isn't interested in say goodbye to your grade.  Treats class as though still in middle school but holds way to high of expectations for a 1101 class.

She can be very rude, critical and condescending.She speaks to the class as if we're children.When reviewing your work or asking her a question, she criticizes and makes rude comments about it out loud, for the ENTIRE class to hear.Grades papers pretty hard, and most of the class had no idea what she was looking for.I got an A,but I'm not sure how.

Professor Schofer is rude and not very helpful. A professor's job is to help students and answer any questions they may have. Schofer never seems to give direct answers and, in that way, she is not very helpful. She instead attacks whatever work you may have done without advice on how to improve. My advice is to steer clear of Maria Schofer.
